Reviews.Title: “Friendly and functional”
Reviews.Author: mick51773
Reviews.Content: The staff we're really friendy and happy to help. Connecting to the free wifi was straightforward as long as your device keeps the signon information so you don't have to re-enter it all every time you connect. Emilio recommended the sights we needed to visit and was spot on. He also told us about a restaurant round the corner and it proved to be a little gem. Our rooom faced the street and it was noisy. However, with the windows closed and the air-con working it wasn't a problem. Breakfast was 'continental' and always a pleasant start to the day. It does get busy at certain times but it wasn't an issue for us. The location was perfect, close enough to the sights without the premium price and with the train and bus station a few minutes walk away, we saved a few pounds by getting the Terravision coach in and out from the airport and took buses to some of the more far flung places like the Vatican. A great base for sightseeng,

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: puddleduck16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Location is brilliant. A few minutes away from termini. 10 minute walk to Colluseum, 15 minute walk to Trevi fountain, 20 minutes to pantheon in one direction or travestere in another, 30 minute walk to Vatican. Breakfast was everything I expected of a continental breakfast- cereal, fruit salad, fresh fruit, juices, cereal, croissant and yogurts. Unsure why people here didn't like it. We couldn't fault it. The staff were great. Very attentive and helpful. Take the map in the lobby- it's the best one we found. And use the restaurant round the corner that is recommended- best pizza we had with cheap wine. We had booked the economy room. So between that and reading these reviews I was prepared for it to be small. But was extremely clean. The shower was good and powerful. Had an easy to use safe. I'm glad we took our little laptop with some programmes loaded on as the only English speaking channels on the tv were BBC world news and CNN news. The only fault I could have was there were times I was gasping for a cup of tea in the evenings and there was no kettle in the room. But looking at their face book page I believe that is soon changing. All in all a great hotel for holidays. I would def stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: chester38
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amalfi Hotel for 5 days in April 2012. Very friendly staff, very nice lady housekeeping staff who are helpful & attend to the morning breakfast & are pleasant & friendly. Breakfast is a variety of cold selections, cereal, juice, pastries, cheeses, salami, ham slices, yogurt, fresh fruit & coffee. Great location to Termini Station. Can walk to the Trevi Fountain in 15 minutes, Colosseum in 10 minutes. Day or half day bus tours can be arranged by the staff. There was a problem with the wifi which the staff fixed promptly. Wifi is free. Safe location, restaurants right at the front door. Self serve laundry facilities near by. Great value for a 3 star hotel. I had a single room with a single bed, which was very affordable, but I am used to a larger bed. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: VforVicky
Reviews.Content: The hotel is placed in a great location which is ideally for sightseeing, while it is walking distance from the central train station. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are not quite spacious, but this is not a problem as most of the hotels in Rome have small rooms. The breakfast is of low quality as there isn't great variety and most of breakfast goods are not freshly made. However, this hotel is value for money and is recommended for short stay holidays in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SHalAyrshire
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hotel Amalfi as part of a 2 city break. It is conveniently placed for the train station and in walking distance of all the sights. The staff were excellent; my wife forgot her umbrella the hotel posted it back to the UK without cost; i was happy to pay their expenses.

Reviews.Title: “the glory that is Rome”
Reviews.Author: lateromantic
Reviews.Content: We arrived back from a 2 night stay at the Amalfi two weeks ago, had a fantastic time whilst there. The Hotel Amalfi is a small pleasant hotel with excellent service and exceptional cleanliness. We took the bus from Flumincino airport to Termini Station for 4 euros each as it was outside rush hour times and we were not hurrying. Bus took 40 mins but didn’t seem to have a timetable so had to wait 30 mins for it. Hotel is a 5 minute walk from Termini. We took the Leonardo Express train from Termini on return which took 30 mins and cost 14 Euros each. Our room at the front was small and the bathroom very small, especially the shower, but as we only needed the room to return to sleep and freshen up it was perfect. The weather was exceptionally warm during the day (24c in March) and so was the room but if you suffer the noise with a window open for ten minutes it cools. Shut the windows, blinds and curtains and there is next to no noise at night. Cosimo greeted us on arrival and within a few minutes we were checked in with maps and directions for everywhere we might visit and discount voucher for their recommended restaurant (Il Nipotino, reviewed separately). The only disappointment with the hotel was breakfast, lukewarm coffee, packaged meat and cheese and possibly also the croissants. Fresh produce was rolls and some fruit but all ok and plenty for the start of day. Also the breakfast room gets busy if you’re not early and sometimes people had to wait for a table. Tripadvisor doesn’t seem to allow for total trip reports so I include our trip highlights here. We did not book any organised tours, did not use a taxi, metro or bus, just walking. The advantage of this is finding wonderful narrow streets with antiques or specialist shops for a myriad of things. The hotel is within walking distance (if reasonably fit) from all sights but plan your trip. The map from the hotel was also excellent. On the afternoon of Day 1 (after a light lunch) we visited the Colesseum, Forum and Palantine true ancient wonders, then wandered down to the stunning Piazza Venezia. Day 2 was an early start to Campo dei Fiori market (slightly disappointing as there were very few flower stalls, Piazza Navonna (beautiful church and fountains} and Pantheon (impressive with the xylophone player out front). We then went on to the Vatican Museum/Sistine Chapel for a 1pm booking(allow at least 2 hours here and be prepared for a sore neck from looking at the ceilings), back to St Peters Basilica and then late afternoon climb Castel de Sant’Angelo for great views and beautiful cupid statue. Day 3 was St Maria Maggiore early, the beautiful basilica closest to the Hotel then along to the Trevi Fountain (where we actually managed to stand by the edge and throw coins in) then up to Piazza d’Espagna/Spanish Steps followed by the calming Piazza del Popolo. From here we walked towards Villa Medici through the gardens where we found a treasure of an oasis in Casina dell Orologio in Via Orologio. This beautiful bar/restaurant was the most attractive and cheapest place for a drink that we found (only 5 euro for a coffee and glass of wine) so we took some time resting here! Finished the day with a walk down Via Corso for shops (not as good as side streets) and the Presidential palace Quirinale to see the guards (couldn’t see them). Skip the Line? What line? The only place we booked tickets for was the Vatican Museum/Sistine Chapel as we knew our time was tight. Did this online with the official Musei.Vaticani site for a reservation fee of 4 euros (total 18.00 euros each) but didn’t need it, walked straight in. Longest queue was into St Peters which was 10 minutes! Assume queues were short as it was pre Easter time. A really great trip and a hotel which was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly & helpful staff, good value and clean”
Reviews.Author: JandLN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an economic double room which was small but fine as we were out sightseeing most of the time! Close to the main attractions and convenient location for getting the train from and to the airport. Staff were helpful - recommending restaurants, giving guidance on public transport etc. Breakfast was ok although nothing special. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and conveniently located hotel for a good value”
Reviews.Author: rishparmar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and overall the stay was comfortable. Best point about this hotel is the location. 5 mins walk for main train station of Rome- Termini, 15 mins walk to the Colloseum, 15 mins walk to the Trevi fountain, Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore is right outside the hotel, Imperial Forum, Spanish Steps, Piazza Novona, all within walking range. Room are small like all Italian hotel rooms but are clean, bathrooms are also clean. Breakfast is okay, not too much variety but decent enough. Many good restaurants are outside and they are open until late. We used to walk late night in Rome and did not have any problems, there are lot of people on streets at night. Franchesco, among the hotel staff, usually at the reception was very polite and helpful and gave us tips to plan the day and outings. We also had a Roma Pass which helped us in entrance to 2 monuments/museums with free transportation in bus/subway for 3 days of activation. You would also have to pay 3Euros/night as city tax apart from your reservation and other charges.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Patricia B
Reviews.Content: We found that the Staff at this hotel were very friendly in all aspects Rooms small but comfortable. Breakfast very good. Clean throughout and it was a perfect spot for sight seeing.We found a small family Restaurant just a short walk away which was perfect after a long day of walking and the food was very good.We were close to the Termini and the very impressive Santa Maria Maggiore We did a lot of walking and it was convenient and central for our needs. We took a train journey to Monte Cassino and found the trains to be in need of some updating, but all in all it was a perfect spot for us. We would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: baileysandcream
Reviews.Content: Location is great near lots of restaurants and train station. Staff friendly at front desk and in breakfast room. Small rooms but adequate for short stays. Pillows very hard and uncomfortable. I would give this rating based on a budget hotel, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: HelenCamille
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel from the 24th Feb - 28th Feb. We booked through Citalia. The hotel exceeded are expecations for a 3 star hotel. The hotel was very clean, the staff were very friendly and hotel is in a ideal location. On arrival, we were greeted by Emilio who gave us lots of information and recommended a nearby restaurant. For the first night we didnt want to venture out too far so the restaurant which is called Nipotina del Solitario was perfect as it is a 3 min walk way. The food was very good and very well priced. Back to the hotel, our room was excellent - very spacious and clean. Our room number was 209 which was excellent as we had a view of Via Merulana so we could see Santa Maria Maggiore. At breakfast we were welcomed by Natasha (or Natalia) who was very friendly. She was out to please and made sure you had everything you wanted at breakfast. You could help yourselves to Cereal, juices, pastries, bread, jams and yoghurts. I have no complaints about the breakfast however i think the choice of things on offer could be extended. I will recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Rome - one of the main reasons being the staff and their service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Vikki B
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location near termini station, close to lots of famous sites, friendly staff, free wifi. Just breakie needs to improve a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great, family run hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: alissa2128
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi Hotel in July '11 for four nights after reading great things about it on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. When we arrived, we were greeted at the front desk and given loads of information to help us navigate the city. We were also given a great restaurant recommendation that was just down the street as it was late and we were starving. The room was good, small, but standard for Europe. Bathroom was good sized, bigger than what we had in our previous two European hotels. The room was a little musty, but not too bad. It was very hot out, so we did have the air conditioner cranked up. My one issue with the room was that the shower only had a hand-held nozzle and a shower curtain instead of a shower door, and it was difficult to manuever without spraying the water towards the back wall. It took a few times, and we could tell we weren't the only ones to have trouble. This was not a huge deal to us, though. The breakfast was included on the price of our room, and it did not disappoint. It was continental style with cereal, pastries, coffee, tea, juice, etc. We were very happy to be able to enjoy this each morning. The staff in the breakfast room was also very helpful and friendly. The hotel was in a pretty good location for us. It was within walking distance to Termini station, but also within walking distance to many of the sights. We walked almost everywhere. On our last day, our flight was later so we were able to keep our luggage at the hotel while we were out. The staff also arranged for airport transport for us, which picked us up at the door. We were able to utilize the lounge area while waiting for this, as well, and they have a very nice, good sized bathroom that we could change and freshen up in after our day out before leaving for the airport. Overall, we highly recommend the Amalfi Hotel. If we ever return to Rome, we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBerlin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk from Termini Station whether you come in from the airport by coach or train. The welcome at the hotel was warm and friendly and loads of infomation was offered with maps and relevant brochures for relevant attractions. Just ask the questions the reception staff were willing to answer and spoke good enough english to give informative answers. There is a small life (1 person/1 case), the room had a double bed but again was very small with a small but fully eqipped bathroom. The hotel is on a traffic-busy road but don't worry there was NO noise inside the hotel - only the other guests going up and down the stairs. The breakfast was basic but certainly adequate to fill up till lunch. The location of the hotel I found perfectly adequate for exploring Rome. I took the No40 bus to the Vatican and walked back - this took in St Peters, Castel Sant Angelo, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Vittorio Emanuele Monument, the Colosseum and loads more delights in between. You can do all this in one day quite easily without any rush and loads of food and ice-cream in between. Restaurants - for close to the hotel I would ask at the hotel reception - I was given a card for a place in a near by street - I introduced myself from the hotel and was looked after - the hotel clearly took the introduction seriously. There are loads of good places to eat - but beware in taking a look - like anyware there appeared to be the full range. Overall this is a friendly clean hotel in a good location taking the price into account - I would return for a short stay. My top tip for sleep quality would be "pillows", The pillows were extremely firm !!! which affected sleep quality , Ask for others or take your own!!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great breakfast and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Keziahloris
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas in Rome and we stayed in this hotel. The staff were very helpful and really nice. Croissant tastes really good! Maggiore church is just a short walk from the hotel. The room was a bit small but It's very clean. maybe 10 minutes walk to the Colloseum. I will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Musafirhoonyaro
Reviews.Content: A family run Hotel , well located , neat , clean & prompt service . check in & out was meticulous & fast . the hotel staff gives a personalised service with a smile . Breakfast service in the dining room was well laid & catered to all tastes . the manager was helpful in planning our itinerary for visiting various attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Alvision
Reviews.Content: From the moment we came through the door till the moment we left we felt very welcome at this hotel. The reception staff were very helpful and efficient and gave us lots of useful information about the places to visit showing us on a map and advising us about public transport. The room was comfortable but a little on the small side but the location and staff more than made up for this. As we were at the back we had no view out but it was quiet and we could hear no traffic noise. Its a short walk from termini train station and the maggiore church is at the end of the road which for me was as spectacular as st.peters. The room was cleaned daily but was spotless to start with. The breakfast was continental and we never left hungry as there was an array of cereals, pastries, yoghurts, breads, cheeses and meats. The hotel is a short walk from the colloseum and the centre of rome and has plenty of good restaurants around it, the one recommened by reception (nipotino del solitario) was execellent and apparantly frequented by Francesco Totti (roma/italian football legend). When I come back to rome I will be definately staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Milez
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Amalfi is a very friendly and well run little hotel a stones throw from Termini Railway station. The rooms like most city hotels are a little small (but the hotel is only a base after all) but very clean and the staff at the hotel are very helpful and very very friendly. If you read the other reports you will see that the breakfast is mentioned a lot and this is because there is more than enough on offer to set up up for a nice days sight seeing. I would like to thank the hotel staff for pointing out the Nipotino del Solitario as a good place to eat as well as its a little gem of a resturant we would not have found had it not been for them. Also I have noticed that a few reviews mention street noise....my room was on the first floor and I had no issues sleeping, yes there was a little noise but in the centre of Rome I would have been very surprised if there wasnt !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: andgreyskies
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Amalfi was fantastic value for money- although the hotel room was a little on the small side, it was nicely decorated and very clean with good double glazing and a spacious wardrobe and two little desks. The beds were comfy and sheets were changed every two days. The breakfast was great, with a good selection. The croissants were especially nice! The lady who served the breakfast was lovely, nothing too much trouble. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. The location was great- round the corner from the Metro and close to the Termini Station, yet walking distance from the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ktraveler81
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with a friend -- I was pleasantly surprised! It was very clean and in a great location. We stayed in room 101 which was actually really big, but no view. The breakfast had all the staples needed to start the day and some very strong coffee :) I would recommend staying here if you are looking for a reasonable place in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, convinient and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Giierose
Reviews.Content: Took my partner here for a long weekend, was very imprssed! Firstly, the staff are all so friendly and welcoming and very helpful. The rooms although small were very clean and tidy with a nice on suite. The location on this hotel is fab, right by termini station and in walking distance to the colloseum, trevi fountains and not too fat from the vatican. All in all was a brilliant weekend and would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bravo for Amalfi”
Reviews.Author: sdkiki
Reviews.Content: The staff were outstanding and very helpful, especially Cosimo. I loved the morning coffee and the breakfast of yogurt, fruit, cheese, rolls was more than adequate. The elevator was tiny so I took the stairs, a good thing after my daily gelato! My room was small but I only slept there. The bathroom was remodeled and I had plenty of hot water. It was a little far from my friends' apartment for me but is in a handy location, near the train station. I definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ashli F
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel and rooms are simple but clean. It is in a great location to walk and see things. It is also very close to one of the hop on hop off bus stops. The hotel was very clean and the staff was great. Breakfast is basic but nice to have the option there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: msshepherd47
Reviews.Content: I took my 2 grandchildren to Italy the day after Christmas. The Amalfi Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly, helping us with our WIFI connection and general information. The location was great, walking distance to everything you want to see and near the subway and train station. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: christineleesang
Reviews.Content: A delightful,ornate and cosy hotel. Very clean with very helpful staff. Great location and within walking distance of main attractions and the Termini station. The continental breakfast was good. A beautiful hotel which matches the beauty of Rome. Highly recommended for a short stay in this city!

Reviews.Title: “Glad to stay here”
Reviews.Author: tguclu
Reviews.Content: Me & my wife have stayed here for 3 nights between 16-19 December-2011 and everything was quite good. It was a small double room but was larger than what I expected. Price was very reasonable when compared to other hotels. Location is close to termini station (approx < 5min). And you can goto Coloseo by 10 minute walk. The staf were very helpful and you got %5 discount if you pay cash during checkout. Only minor points I would say that there was only one radiator and it was in bathroom. So the room can be cold if winter. And there was no fork in breakfast. I don't know and we did not bother on this. Breakfast was OK , cheese , croisant , orange juice , small packed nutella , packet meat , coffe or tea, yoghurt with fruit. Staff in the reception at arrival gave us some trip directions on may, I think his name was Francesco . It was very good. We followed his remarks for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “We're really glad we stayed at this lovely little family run hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bourkemob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned from a long weekend in Rome yesterday. We found the Amalfi to be clean and comfortable, all the staff we came across were helpful and friendly. The hotel is ideally located, close to the main train station (Terravision bus from Fiumicino Airport €8 return) and within walking distance of most of the attractions, all of them if you like walking! Good breakfast of cold meats, cheeses, patés, yoghurts, bread, croissants, fruit, etc, though disappointed by the coffee. Good restaurants close-by with very reasonable set menus (€13 for seafood risotto starter, prawn and squid main course, salad, bread and a glass of wine! Sorry, can't remember the name but it's just around the corner in a small side street). No tea/coffee making facilities, take your travel kettle. Mini bar prices reasonable and there is a small supermarket just over the road. Highly recommended for a long weekend in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Cornerturned
Reviews.Content: The concierge were very knowledgable and helpful! The hotel was just minutes away from Termini and Samta Maria Maggiore. The breakfast was a great way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: nscementer
Reviews.Content: Everyone we seen at the hotel were very helpful. The hotel is great to walk to and from the train station and also to most attractions. They have a wonderful breakfast in the morning and the lady who takes care of it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: fidgettyphil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi Hotel for three nights in November 2011. Everything was fine: staff helpful and friendly, ample breakfast with plenty of choice, comfortable rooms etc. The best thing was it's location - within easy reach of the main sites, public transport and good restaurants. Centrally located yet quiet. I had problems getting wi-fi connection but never asked anyone to fix it because I was too busy enjoying Rome. I'm sure it could have been sorted. Don't forget to ask for a discount if you pay in cash, it worked for me!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tia B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October 2011. It is located quite close to Termini station, and provided a base for our tour pickups (also arranged through the hotel). It is a very nice, traditional looking hotel, quite cozy and pretty clean. The staff were all very friendly and spoke good English. The breakfast here was very good and so was the breakfast lady - she was so nice! Termini is not the most upscale area in Rome but this hotel is very nice and safe. We also had a balcony in our room which was wonderful. Beds are a little on the soft side but I think it's like that in Europe everywhere. All in all, thanks Hotel Amalfi for a good stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel extremely clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: john c
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here in November 2011 and could not fault it in any way.Excellent location and super breakfast to set us up for the day ! Plenty of nearby cafes and restaurants. A really nice friendly atmosphere which made for a great mini break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel for tourists exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Wahroongan
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at hotel Amalfi, in Aug 2011. It's a smallish hotel with a very convenient location for the tourist wanting to explore Rome. If you just step out the hotel, you already see Santa Maria Maggiore on your left and most places interesting to tourists, such as the Colosseum are at walking distance from there. The Amalfi hotel is relatively small. The furnishing is bit old but have a bit of old world charm about it. I had a single room which wasn't huge but there was sufficient storage, a good bathroom and even a balcony. I'm a bit of a "clean freak" and even I was impressed how immaculately clean everything was. There was not even a speck of mould in the bathroom, where most hotels fail this test. The airconditioning was effective and not too noise and gave a welcome reprieve from the late summer heat. The staff was friendly and there was a relaxed familiy atmosphere about the place. They were very accomodating (but Romans are easy going people in general - no problem is insurmountable) and either helped me directly or gave good advice that helped me to sort out questions and problems tourists might have. E.g. one day i had a day trip (which they helped to arrange) and I had to leave much earlier than the start of breakfast. The staff on duty insisted that I didn't leave with empty stomach and even packed me a few bites for the road. :-) The people on duty at the front desk were speaking good English although one person didn't seem to understand the concept of late check-out. Still, the problem was solved to my satisfaction, so no complaints. I noticed the place is very popular with Brittish and Australian tourists. If you are the sort of person who wants an army of hotel staff looking after you, a gym with an olympic size pool, a floor manager who is always on duty etc. than maybe this is not the hotel for you but if you are a tourist wanting to explore Rome, who wants a comfortable crash pad which is clean and has a friendly atmosphere, Hotel Amalfi is a great choice. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, very accommodating staff, near termini, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: visit0r86
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near termini but not too near, it's just right outside the beautiful santa maria Maggiore church. it's easy to get around because all trains and buses stop at termini, the service was nice and friendly, very accommodating, as we checked in the receptionist draw on the map where are the bus lines we would need and what's their route, he also recommended a cute little family restaurant nearby and we ended up having the best time. overall this hotel offers good value for the money, the rooms are large, clean, always has hot water, not noisy and the breakfast offers a great selection, it's great it's included in the price. also the hotel has a great shuttle service we booked for the airport at 14e per person it's a real bargain considering a train to the airport costs the same and then you have to walk with your suitcases, we stayed for 6 nights and we loved it, the only downside is that you have to walk 15-20 mins to get to piazza venzia and the area if you want to go out at night, but near the hotel there are great restaurants and not expensive so unless you are looking for a night life and clubbing you are set with this hotel. i would defently recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lillian and Irene find a little gem”
Reviews.Author: bonnie061
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this small and friendly hotel during the first week in November. We asked in advance for a specific type of room due to special requirements and our needs were met very well. All the staff were cheerful and helpful when we required information and our stay was made all the more pleasant because of their attitude towards their guests. We can confirm all the previous positive reviews about the Amalfi hotel itself and also about the ability to walk to all the major places of interest, even at our age -( 60 yrs). We've never seen so many wonderful places in such a short time. We were issued with a good map on arrival and were able to find every famous monument with no trouble at all. We actually walked off the map several times because there are so many interesting things to see. We would love to return to Rome and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jackie-Butler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi Hotel for 3 nights in September and had the most fantastic time. It's in a very good location, and we were able to walk to most places we wanted to see. The rooms are small, but who needs a large room to sleep in, because this was the only time we were in the room. They were very clean which is the most important thing to us. I contacted Francesco before our departure and asked about excursions, he was very helpful and organised all of these for us, we only had to pay for these on arrival. All staff couldn't have been more polite or helpful. The only improvement I would have liked is tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Thank you Francesco for every thing we had a fantastic time staying with you.

Reviews.Title: “Price and location”
Reviews.Author: FrankieGrl
Reviews.Content: For the price & location this was a good choice. We stayed 3 nights at the beginning of our trip in a tiny room & even tinier bathroom (#208). That was fine - we've come to expect small accomodations when in Europe. Room was clean and location was fine - close to termini, sights and metro stops. Breakfast was basic - but we're not big breakfast eaters....The next week we wanted to stay in back in Rome the last night before we flew out and I searched extensively for a reasonable hotel close to Termini Station and chose one more night at Hotel amalfi - really the best deal I found. We were surprised to get a room MUCH bigger than our first one (#316) which was a pleasant surprise - even though we were only there for one last night. Staff was marginally helpful, but we really didn't ask a lot of questions since there appeared to be a language barrier. So, if you already know what you want to do in Rome and want a good deal (by Rome's standards) on a hotel room that you'll only sleep in for a few hours, this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DuaneL687129
Reviews.Content: Helpful Staff. Ultra clean. Great Breakfasts. Nicely decorated. Good advice on local restaurants and transportation. Price is competitive. Great location for walking to tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MJWRGW
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews we'd read and we were very pleased. The hotel is located close to the Termini station for train and bus services. The basilica Santa Maria Maggiore is very close as are a variety of shops and bars. The main attractions including the Colosseum, the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and The Pantheon are all within walking distance. We caught the bus to the Vatican City and walked back. Our room was fairly small but spotlessly clean, with en suite shower/bath room. The air conditioning worked, the bed was comfortable. It was perfectly adequate. The breakfast was typically continental with plenty of variety consisting of juices, fruit, yoghurt, rolls, croissant, sweet and savoury, breads, cereals and a choice of hot drinks. The hotel owner was very helpful and friendly and the other members of staff were the same. The owner arranged for transport from the hotel to the airport via minibus which cost the same as the train fare (Leonardo Express) but more convenient. There were some super restaurants just around the corner in Via di San Martino ai Monti - we would highly recommend the La Forchetta for good food at very good prices. This an excellent, friendly, family run hotel which is ideal for visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel suitable for very small people only”
Reviews.Author: puckpool
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated near the Church of Santa Maria Maggiore and it is a good location for the Colesseum and the Roman Forum. The hotel itself is tiny in every respect. A tiny reception lead to a miniscule lift - the smallest I have ever seen. We tried to put two suitcases and one person in the lift and it was impossible. The room was very small indeed. We had a double bedroom and although the bed wasn't absolutely up against the wall it was hard to walk round it to get in. There were all kinds of things wrong with the room - bumps in the plaster, a bit of skirting board that kept falling off. The television couldn't be turned round to give a good view because it was half behind the curtains because of the small room. At first sight the bathroom looked o.k. but the plunger nob in the washbasin was missing so you had to push a sharp spike to empty the basin . When you did empty the basis the floor flooded as there was an overflow plate in the tiled floor and this was soon awash. Plus points - very helpful reception staff (although I don't think they would have been so helpful or friendly if you complained) and an excellent lady who served breakfast. She was the star of this hotel.; The breakfast room was very small and people often had to wait for tables to be free to eat their meal. The breakfast rolls are appalling. Aerated, hollow and hard. Usually for us the Italian breakfast is the highlight of the stay - not this time. The rooms looked clean enough but the net curtains were sepia throughout the hotel. Tremendous traffic noise and dirt. Advertised as having a roof terrace - don't be fooled. The lift doesn;t go all the way up to the terrace and you have to wedge the door open or it slams behind you and then you're up there for ages. No chairs, tables nothing except a small washing line and a mop. We have stayed in Italy many times over the last 20 years and I have stayed in Rome twice before this. The hotel Amalfi was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in in Italy and possibly anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: karlab
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe we left Rome just last week, it feels like forever ago! Amalfi Hotel is perfectly located. it is within walking distance to the train station and a lot of the major sites in Rome - the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Palantine Hill, Borghese Gallery (30 min walk thru a nice area) and a lot of the "must see" churches in Rome, While we were in Rome for 5 days, we only took the Metro once to the Vatican, and a cab once to go out to dinner after a long day. Our room was very small, but clean and neat. There was a small mini bar in our room, and the prices were quite reasonable. The beds were quite hard, and the pillows very thin, but we were so exhausted at the end of every day that we slept really well! Breakfast was basic; it was enough for me, but towards the end of our trip my husband was really craving an American breakfast of eggs, etc. Housekeeping came every day and seemed to do a great job. The front desk staff very very friendly and always willing to help. When we checked in the man at the front desk gave us a big map and marked down all the places we should see, and even drew out on the map how we should get to these places! it was such a big help, we carried that map around with us every day while we were in Rome! All in all, I would recommend this hotel. My only advice is that if you are looking for a good sized room, this hotel may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: tamar751
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 days.hospitality was great.breakfast very good,keeps us all day (there is no eggs or vegtable).the hotel is 7 min.from termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Ray T
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is exceptional. It is within walking distance of St. Maria Basilica, train station, Colosseum and other major sites, as well as good places to eat. The breakfast is only adequate. The beds and pillows are very hard. However, the room is well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: carmen2001
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and comfortable. Continental breakfast was lovely, good variety and plenty to keep us going. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Great hotel and within walking distance of main attractions. Thanks to Amalfi Hotel for an enjoyable stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: spock15
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Amalfi for 4 nights from 27th September. I can only reinforce the many positive reviews for this hotel. The hotel and the rooms were spotlessly clean. Every member of staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is in a great location to explore Rome. Although we are not so young and agile anymore we walked everywhere only using public transport to visit the Vatican/St Peter's. The breakfast was good and we were impressed that most things were individually wrapped and nothing was open to flies etc. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and it easily earns it's 3 start rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great front Desk staff”
Reviews.Author: pointaquariusgal
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel & centrally located. The front desk people are exceptional. We had a mishap while we were there which involved leaving a backpack in a taxi & losing all our travel vouchers & train tickets. These great people called taxi cab companies for us & allowed us to use their personal computer to reprint all of our tour vouchers.The backpack was never returned but thanks to the Amalfi staff, we were still able to go to all our prepaid tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel feel”
Reviews.Author: AdrianGlv
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Hearing the bells chiming from the nearby church was great. Location was ideal - close to tour companies, restaurants, cafés and the big train station. Not a far walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps (30 minutes or so and lots to see along the way). Incredibly friendly staff that remembers your name & room number each time you return. And the best part - a fantastic breakfast! Even over just a one-night stay, I felt so incredibly welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Frendly staff and nice hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ilovecosmos
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location and next to the beautiful Santa Maria Maggiore and was great for our 3 night stay in Rome. Our room was quite small but just what we needed. The staff were friendly and helpful. Slightly disappointed that there was only a shower in our bathroom and after a long day walking around Rome it would have been nice to relax in a bath.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, warm, friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Lillieben
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Amalfi for 3 days, 2 nights. Aside from the great location, and cleanliness of this hotel what we loved the most was the staff. The hotel is primarily run by family. Cosimo, Francesco(Cosimos son) & Domenico were all very helpful and made my husband and I feel like family. The complimentary breakfast was delicious, a bit early but worked out great so that we could take full advantage site seeing in our short stay. In the breakfast area was Cosimos wife and another lady who's names unfortunately we can't remember but were very kind as well. Cosimo welcomed us and gave us a map with detailed guidance as to where to visit and the best ways to get there. When you exit the hotel you can go right and make your first right at the first street and not to far down (about 5 min walking)is a bakery which is great to get snacks to go for the day. Cosimo called it Panifiche. We have stayed at great 5 star hotels all over the U.S. and the carribean but what makes this place great is it's warmth and great staff. 10 min walk termini station & bus station Hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MsCleo2313
Reviews.Content: The Good: The hotel is lovely and is in an excellent location. Step out the front door, look to your left, and in front of you is the Santa Maria Maggiore. The bus stop is across the street, and the shop to purchase your metro tickets (tabbachi) is just two or three shops away from the hotel. Lots of restaurants and shopping are right in the area, and when you get tired of pasta and gelato, there is a lovely schwarma (gyro) shop in the same block as the hotel. Rooms are small and in European fashion, there are no washcloths as what you would see in the U.S. Admittedly, the room for single use looks like a dorm room from college years, however, the room was spotless, and the bed sheets were crisp and clean. The staff? Very friendly and accommodating. While I don't have any names, the front desk clerks and the lovely woman in the restaurant were all eager to please. I had an early morning flight back to the US. The hotel arranged a taxi for me, the taxi arrived promptly on time, and the gentleman at the front desk even called my room to advise me that the taxi was waiting! There was breakfast served in the restaurant. Typical continental fare – muffins, danishes, cereal, fruit cocktail, cheese and salami, and orange juice and fresh peaches – and it was enough to keep you going until your next meal. The beds? Well...I'm not used to firm mattresses, so sleeping was a little tough for me, but hey – you're not in Rome to sleep, right? FYI - there is free WiFi at the hotel, but if you don't have a laptop, there is an internet cafe approx. four blocks away. Also, the Tourist Information booth is three blocks away from the hotel. The Not So Great: Be careful of any room on the first floor. While clean as described above, the problem is that they are, quite literally, five steps away from the front desk. As a result, you can hear every conversation that takes place, and that can be a problem if, for example, you want to turn in and have an early night. Also, there are skylights in Rooms 101 and 102 (not sure of the others), so again, if you want to turn in early, you still have natural light streaming into the room. Overall: Would I recommend? Yes! For the price, it was a great bargain, and as stated before, everything was clean and spotless. Indeed, I would definitely recommend the Hotel Amalfi as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central spot in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Khaled_Kamel
Reviews.Content: I made the booking in August !! and found a place, so it is a very nice place that not allot of people know about it is right at the sant maria magriore square, so 5 minutes walk to the central train station and so to the nearest metro. single rooms are almost walk in closets, but they are very clean, and the place is kinda Cozy. not much of a budget bargain but the neighbourhood is good and it offers a safe deposit in your closet for your belongings. staff is very friendly, and the manager is very helpful if you want to ask directions. all in all, a very nice place in the center of Rome for couples who want to have a nice place or single tourists who want a nice place to crash in

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Andrei N
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, it is a nice family business that is superb. I love the attention for details and customer care . It is a nice place to be when in Rome. I say that because of the great position of the hotel.Close to the railway station , metro station ,tourist bus station ,real important historical monument and close to the Coloseum. Our stay there was for a week and we recomend it. Have a nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “less is more”
Reviews.Author: gryffinhead
Reviews.Content: this hotel turned out to be a lot smaller than we had anticipated, but it served its purpose very well. in a place like rome where one would want to be out sightseeing the whole day, its best to stay at a place like this. the reception staff are all cheerful and friendly and they helped us with our sightseeing by providing a map of the city and some valuable advice. the amenities are the basic minimum but we had no reason to complain whatsoever. the only hitch was that breakfast winds up by 9:30 am,so one needs to rise early for it. the hotel is centrally located and we managed to reach all our tourist spots on foot itself, which was a huge advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: K46Llo
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 3 night stay in this hotel and the staff could not have been any nicer. The rooms are small but quite luxiourious and well planned. The bed was comfortable and we had a mini bar for drinks in the night. The breakfast was quite basic continental breakfast. The location was great as it is across the road from the beautiful Santa Maria church and was about 15 min walk to everything else or you can hope on the termini (train) which is a 3 min walk and you are there in no time and it only costs 1 euro in evening to save your feet on the way home! If you book this hotel contact them by phone to arrange taxi transport from airport and back - its alot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “So good we are going again in September 2011”
Reviews.Author: Lesleysmith02
Reviews.Content: Friendly and clean hotel well situated in Rome. Staff very friendly. Rooms though on the small side are well kept and very clean. Breakfasts are wonderful and staff very helpful. Will help you with your Italian. My husband and I stayed there October 2010 for our 20th Wedding anniversary and it was so good we are going back this year for our 21st !

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: AuntBee13
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome with two of my girl friends and stayed at the Amalfi Hotel for three nights. It was perfect for what we needed. We got the tripple room and requested three twin beds which we received. The room was small, but very comfortable for us. Very clean. The bathroom seemed newly renovated and also very clean. They have the BEST windows. We could open the windows to hear the bustling of the street, but after closing, it was so quiet! I was surprised! The location of this hotel is great! Being so close to the termini is a huge asset because if you get a three day bus pass (which we did) and learn the bus system, you can get to everything you want to see very quickly. Bus 40 is the bus that takes you to the Vatican and it was a quick trip. You can catch the 714 bus to get to the termini and then catch it to get back to the hotel (exiting the bus a the maria maggiore stop) if you didn't want to walk to the termini, though it is an easy walk. The breakfast was good. Cereal, pastries, fruit. The lady at breakfast is SO NICE! what a pleasant face to see in the morning! :o) My only complaint is that there isn't someone at the desk at all times when they really need to be since they collect the keys for the day. We were pretty sad to come in one day to see that we could easily just grab our key on our own without anyone seeing. Made us feel a little less secure about our things. But other than than, this hotel exceeded my expectations and I will definitely return to this hotel on my next visit to Rome. Thank you for the good service! PS -- Watch out for the cabbies when you arrive into Rome via the train station. ENSURE that they will use the meter because it should be less than 10 Euro. We were told that it was a flat rate 30 EURO... NOT TRUE. We should have known better because we could have walked!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaWineaux
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amalfi Hotel for 4 nights while visiting Rome. Everyone, the front desk staff to woman who took care of the breakfast buffet, was so friendly and helpful. The front desk called and confirmed an excursion that we had made on the internet before we left home, made restaurant recommendations (which were excellent) and always had a great attitude and friendly smile! This I have to say was so refreshing...especially after having been in Paris before we came to Rome. Our room was small, but very comfortable. Even though it was at the front on a busy street you could hardly hear anything at all. This is a small boutique hotel so if you are looking for something new, big and fancy don't stay here. If you are looking for a quaint, friendly "home away from home" then this is the place for you. The only downside is having to pay for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: ken m
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't have been better for us. We arrived by train and it was a reasonable walk from the train station with bags in tow. The hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable and the continental breakfast was very satisfying. During our two day stay, because of the central location of the hotel, we were able to see all the main attractions and got there on foot. Walking in Rome is the only way to go because you discover so many interesting things and sites along the way that you would miss on a bus. We walked a long way each day, but it never seemed far because we made so many discoveries. Take a guide book because you'll encounter things that you didn't know existed and a good map is very necessary. The hotel staff arranged for a shuttle to pick us up at the hotel and take us to the airport--for the same price as the train would have been, but without all the hassles of pulling the bags to the train station etc. All in all, we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Home in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: RichardO11
Reviews.Content: A small hotel, family-run, well located between the main train terminus and the Colosseum. The family and staff are very helpful. Also, there are some super little restaurants right in the neighbourhood. Easy to get the Metro to most of Rome's highlights. The rooms are small, but perfectly clean and comfortable. A good-value place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with a friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JosieB080
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay, taxi picked us up as arranged and when we arrived got a friendly welcome and lots of useful info about what to see and how to get there. Our room was very clean and comfortable and we only had about half a dozen steps from reception to get to it! Sparkling wine was a lovely touch (50th birthday) and much appreciated. We had a junior suite which was lovely as it gave us plenty of space and the air conditioning worked well. The only downside was not having any view from the window, but we did get a skylight which was controlled by a switch on the wall! Breakfast was as expected with friendly service and plenty to eat. The hotel is on a busy road but we didn't hear any traffic noise and it is in walking distance of the Colliseum, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. We only gotone bus to get to the Vatican (book in advance and look for the group entrance to the Vatican Museums on the right hand side of St Peters Square through the archway). We ended up taking a guided tour which we were a bit unsure about at first but it turned out to be a good move as the museum was so crowded we would'nt have managed to see the best bits without our guide pointing them out. The Colliseum was amazing, again we booked in advance which meant we went through the group entrance and sailed past the queues. Our tip would be to not be suckered into having a picture taken (with your own camera) with the guys dressed as gladiators - 20 euros each if your'e daft enough to pay it!! We were recommended by Guiseppe, (the chap on evening hotel duty) to eat at a restuarant just down the road 'Spaglio et Frisio'? which was an experience we won't forget, food was good but what made it memorable was the piano playing and being serenaded at the table by a small roman gentlemen-three coins in a fountain in Italian was priceless having just visited the Trevi Fountain earlier in the day! All in all we had a fantastic time, would recommend this hotel to anyone who would enjoy a tradional family run hote rather than an impersonal chain.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartinEllie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a package trip to Rome booked by my husband for my birthday treat. Whilst this hotel is only 3 star I would have to say, it gave 5 star hospitality. Our room initially was small and the bathroom very compact, and because of a light in the bathroom not working, our room was immediately changed with no argument. The staff at the Amalfi are worth their weight in gold, nothing, and I mean nothing was too much trouble for them. Their service was excellent and every query was answered :) the breakfast was great and our stay in Rome was great and only made better by the hotel's warmth, knowledge and friendliness. If you are on a low budget, I would recommend this hotel unreservedly. Thank you Francesco and staff. Marie and Jon Wright - 31/05 - 03/06/11

Reviews.Title: “Great Family-run hotel at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: aemolina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this hotel on Tripadvisor, and I wanted to write in about our experience. It was great! This is a small, family-run hotel in a conveniently-located area of Rome. Francesco greeted us upon our arrival and gave us a brief orientation to the city and its sites (map included!). He was very friendly and helpful--helped arrange transportation for us to the airport at the conclusion of our stay. As well, anytime that we had a question or an issue, the staff was extremely helpful and gracious in assisting us--even called our room on one occasion to offer additional assistance and to make sure that we had resolved a problem during our stay. The hotel was very comfortable and clean. I can't say enough good things about the Amalfi Hotel and its wonderful staff. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fanatstic Hotel, would heartily recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: DC_JC2011
Reviews.Content: We booked our Hotel from tripadvisor comments so its only right that we add to the impressive number of happy visitors. At check in we were warmly greeted and made to feel right at home. Being English and nowhere near bi-lingual was no problem here! We were given a map and advised how much one could do in a day, areas highlighted and bus routes indicated!!!! Our room was spotless, air con already on for our arrival (which is very simple to control!) Bed comfy, plenty of space for our clothing, room safe very easy to set up, mini bar replenished every morning and bathroom towels changed as needed. Breakfast was thoroughly enjoyable in a nice airy room, Fresh pastries and rolls with enough meats and conserves to kick start your day, fruit salads, fresh fruit, hot drinks to order, each table vacated was quickly stripped and fresh table cloth laid out for the next guests, absolutely top draw customer service, the ladies who looked after us were very polite and friendly as was every person on reception 24 hours a day! We wanted to make our Rome holiday as authentic as possible, we didn't want to go to a chain with HR trained plastic staff. I cannot say enough good things about the Amalfi, our stay was exactly what we wanted. We would love to come back! Thanks for having us!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LucyLeamington
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem so I will definitely return and would recommend this to all. The staff were very friendly. On arrival we were allocated the incorrect bedroom, but were given a complimentary bottle of Prosecco for the inconvenience and the opportunity to change rooms. The bedrooms were cleaned everyday so were immaculate. Although we had a good street view the others in our group had back rooms, but the benefit of these were that they were very quiet. Contrary to some of the reviews, the continental buffet breakfast was lovely. The location was great, walking distance to main sites such as the Coliseum, Roman Forum and Palatine Hill etc, and there were some great restaurants on our street, I would particularly recommend: Scoglio di Frisio; Address: 256 Via Merulana. A fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: histonite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here with our friends; we found it a very good location only 20 minute walk to The Colosseum and 10 minutes from the station. Reception staff very friendly and helpful, and breakfast is a good continental style buffet. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. I recommend the Rome Hop On/Off bus, a 2 day ticket for 20 Euro is good value and stops very near hotel. Go to Vatican City on a Wednesday morning and the Pope does an outside service infront of St Peter's at 11am.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: KATSAR99
Reviews.Content: Amalfi Hotel in Rome is fantastic. It is located close to Termini Train station and within walking distance of Colliseum. Our room was a triple, and perfect for us with A/C and free wireless. Breakfast was included, and also great. Most of all, the staff at this hotel and is friendly, helpful and kind, and happy doing their jobs. We would stay there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Larry077
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Amalfi hotel. We stayed 8 nights and loved it. The entire staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Francesco booked a trip for us to Capri and helped us to get train tickets to Florence. The waitress, Natasha, was very friendly and her service was great. The entire staff was absolutely fantastic. The room was a little small but was very clean and very adequate, The location is excellent and in the city cenrer and close to the train station and bus stops. It is also walking distance to many of the attractions. If we return to Rome, we will definitely stay at Amalfi again. We recommend staying here. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “10/10”
Reviews.Author: extased
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to visit Rome in Jan 2011. Me and my girlfriend were worried about booking a hotel in Rome as we didn't have a big budget. We did a lot of research and used tripadvisor and eventually chose Amalfi (after cancelling a booking elsewhere). The hotel, from the outside, doesn't look much. However once inside it is very beautiful. We were greeted at reception by a lovely lady who took time with us to welcome us and show us all the sights on a map. She was really helpful and it was a great first impression. Our room was on the 4th floor and faced the street. There is a very small lift which can hold 2 people. The bathroom in our room was lovely, very new and clean with a fantastic shower. There was almost no road noise due to the good windows. We don't really watch TV but they had some music channels and sport which was good for me! Also the mini bar had nice cold beer which was very reasonable. It also had an electronic safe. Breakfast was very nice and again there is a really friendly and lovely lady who tends to breakfast. She was so friendly and helpful! There were sweet and savoury croissants, cold meats and cheeses, rolls, bread and hot coffee. I thought for the cost of the room it was much better than expected. Location is very good also. You are a 10 minute walk to the main Roma Termini station. You can actually see Basilica Santa Maria Maggiore from the room and that is worth a visit. The Coloseum is about 25 minutes walk away. Everything is within easy reach either walking or by Metro. We walked from the Vatican to the hotel on our last day, stopping by Trevi fountains and Spanish steps on the way. We ate at a couple of local restaurants to the hotel - one was a deli/bar type place called L'Esquilino Ristorante which was a couple of streets away on Via Cavour and was excellent. We also ate at another place which was about 105 Via Cavour (Gallo Mallo or something) and that was great. Once we cracked a few jokes with the waiter he became really friendly there. I think you need to have a sense of humour to get on well with Romans. We also met two gentlemen on the hotel reception desk. Both were very friendly and helpful and allowed us to keep our luggage in the hotel when we went out on our last day. Considering everything with this hotel I really feel it deserves top marks. For the price I don't think anything needs to be changed. Our room was lovely, really nice shower, friendly and helpful staff and a good location. The only issue we had was that we wanted to leave a tip but we didn't know if it was the correct thing in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: justustravellers
Reviews.Content: Our trip started on the right foot. Our transportation from the airport was arranged by the hotel. our driver was holding a sign with our name on it. No wait, no fuss, and all for 50euros. At the hotel we were greeted by Francesco, who gave us so much information, that we were overwhelmed with joy. Our room was clean, spacious, with a small off room, and a fairly large bathroom. The room faced the street, but it has great windows and the noise level was very low. Breakfast was included and was very good, with various coffes, croissant, cheese, meats, cookies, cereals, crackers and other various items. We were very happy with this hotel and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: bluemoon44
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights in the small hotel in Rome. The room was small, which we expected from this hotel, and although we had no drawers had everything else we needed. Overlooking a busy road is was noisy during the day, although double glazing kept out the noise. At night it was quiet and we slept well in our comfartable bed. The buffet breakfast was good with a most attentive lady present to provide tea, cofee and help with anything else we needed. The reception staff spoke good English and were delighted to offer advise on resturants and trips etc. Should we return to Rome we would be pleased to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, inexpensive little hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: notatoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one week on our first trip to Rome. They were super friendly and helpful and made arrangements to extend our stay at the last minute. The location was fantastic, just a 5 minute walk from Termini (main bus) station. The rooms were kind of small, but for a city where hotels are so expensive, we were just happy to have a decent room at a decent price. The caretaker was a real character and very personable. The breakfast was adequate. Be sure to avoid going around the corner though as one morning we ordered breakfast (two coffees and croisants) and paid 30 Euro!!! I would advise avoiding any place that has a person outside coaxing you in (in English), and there are MANY!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca1pink
Reviews.Content: Like many on this site I did a lot of research to find somewhere to stay in Rome. Some of the best options were fully booked so I plumped for the Amalfi where we stayed for 5 days. Firstly I should start with the positives of this hotel. Its less than 10 mins walk to the Termini station - great both for travel to the airport but also for the numerous buses that depart. Its also a stones throw from Santa Maria Maggiore (well worth a visit). its also within walking distance of numerous trattorias (try to get away from the main streets for the best places). Then to the negatives. We booked a twin room but in reality it was a double room. If you are intending to share a room with someone who you are not really close to I would think again. There were two beds but they were jammed up together. We tried to put a bit of space in between but without fail the maid put them together again. The room was also very small but I guess that is a given for Rome. The room was stifling hot. It apparently had aircon but this was not controllable. For the first few nights we tried having the window open but the road noise was loud to say the least. On a plus note if you need to get laundry dry it dried in the room in a couple hours! I am surprised by the reviews of breakfast being good. It was exactly the same every day for 5 days we were there. No fresh fruit at all just some tinned stuff. All the meats and cheeses were processed and in packaging. One kind of juice if you can call it juice as it tasted like rather strong orange squash. The breakfast room is also fairy small and on a couple mornings we noticed a few poor couples having to queue for tables which I think is not acceptable in a 3 star expensive hotel. FInally for my complaints would be the lady on reception when we checked out. She was beyond rude about paying for room tax. We had not been told about having to pay in cash and were low to say the least on our euros. She could at least have been pleasant about it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, will definitely come back and stay next time”
Reviews.Author: Loki1978
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on tripadvisor prior to my Rome trip and found this hotel was rated reasonably well, I booked without great expectations and was amazed. The location is fabulous (walking distance from the Colosseum, Forum, Palatine Hill and other major tourist spots). This is not a 5 star luxurious hotel, you don't get a massive variety of breakfast options but what you do get is impeccable cleanliness and the best service I have ever had in ANY hotel (and I have had the great fortune to stay in 5 & 6 star hotels in Asia and around the world). There was nothing that was too difficult for them, we asked for directions to a local internet cafe and were offered to use the hotels front desk computer (we then got to help out collecting keys from guests going out for the day) which really made us feel like we were more than just guests. They also provided us with recommendations for restaurants in the local area. We ate in one which is just around the corner from the hotel called 'Il Nipotino Del Solitario', it can be found on Via S. Martino ai monti. This was one of the best meals our entire trip The best we ate at was a place called Il Bacaro which needs reservations unless you go early, it can be found 27 Via degli Spagnoli, near the Pantheon. I'd recommend you sit outside under the vine arbour. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome, it is great value, really friendly excellent service and impeccably clean.

Reviews.Title: “My second visit”
Reviews.Author: BellaGirlTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Amalfi 20 years ago with my parents, and now had the opportunity to take my own family. Hotel is very conveniently located near termini, close to sainta maria maggiore which is not only a lovely site, but also a stop on the hop on hop off bus routes. Rooms standard European size - windows worked well to block out noise from busy via murleana. Staff lovely and attentive to our young child. Happy to have stayed again at the Hotel Amalfi.

Reviews.Title: “Amalfi hotel and Rome go together”
Reviews.Author: FamilyBlueBird
Reviews.Content: First time to Rome first time to the Amalfi could'nt be better. Hotel coulnt be better positioned. walk round the corner to the coliseum. Accross the road to The Sante Maria Maggiorei an absolute must if you visit Rome along with St Peters and St Cecilia's free entry ( but down in the cript at St Cecilia's for 2.50 euros) well worth the money Shops restauants outside the hotel. Metro 5 minute walk 1 euro gives you 75 minutes of travel either on the bus or the trains don't pay 21 euros for a tour bus. Buses are very frequent as are the trains and just two rail lines to learn on the metro, red and blue easy. And now the Hotel. The staff are great three generations of the same family run the hotel knowledgable and so helpful all speak either excellent English are most certainly enough to get by. They know Rome The tourist parts and also the parts that are not on the tourist map Free maps available at the hotel. Room Was great even though traffic outside. With the shutters double glazed windows and heavy curtains most certainly didnt keep me awake, had to set the alarm in the morning to wake up. Breakfast fantastic Continental but great choice and help yourself with waitress to bring you coffee and tea should you so wish very nice and friendly lady. Rooms cleaned every day with fresh towels free safe in room. wonderful wonderful stay thanks to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back.....great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shannon9812
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in this fabulous family run hotel in April. Everyone in this hotel were helpful, friendly and made us feel so welcome. My mother who is elderly said she felt she was treated like the Queen oreven the most important person staying there! They were so kind. The continental breakfast was delicious and the coffee was definately unforgettable, it was the best I ever drank. The hotel is ideally located, overlooking St Mary Major's Basillica, taxi rank 1 minute walk, 5 minute walk from Termini and in safe location.There are many nice restraunts nearby. In addition, this hotel is well placed for sight-seeing and shopping as its within walking distance of many locations as well as near bus and metro transportation. Thank you to everyone in the Amalfi for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value small family hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorktravellers09
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 night stay in Amalfi Hotel. Chose this hotel based on other reviews and was not disappointed. Very friendly and efficient check in with Francesco who provided us with good local information. Hotel is only a 5 minute walk from Termini station so very easy access from airport. Although the rooms were small they were spotlessly clean and met our needs. The only downside was no air conditioning in room at this time of year so had to leave the window open and as the hotel is on a busy road quite a bit of noise but you soon get used to it. Good breakfast each morning which set us up for the day. If you choose this hotel there are two very good but very different restuarants nearby which we would recommend. Leonetti on Via Principle Amendo serving excellent local dishes and the quirky Gallo Rotti on Via Cavour which specialises in whole spit roast chickens and other meat dishes as well as the usual Italian staples.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marion186305
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalfi over the Easter Holidays and couldn't fault the service we received, the rooms were spotlessly clean and the staff couldn't have been more helpful giving us maps and highlighting the attractions. Arriving at Fiumicino Airport a hopper bus to the bus terminal took around 1hour and costs 8 euro's each very good value. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the bus terminal, it is a 20 minute walk to the Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain, a 2 day pass on the tour bus was 20 euro's's each and you get on and off when you like it takes you to St Peter's and the Vatican and lots of other attractions. we will certainly stay at the Amalfi again. Rob and Marion Herts

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CamilaFreitas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, near the Termini Station. From this station there are trains to almost every destination in Italy and in Europe and also the two lines of metro. The personnel of the hotel is very kind and helpful, and the breakfast is delicious. In a nutshell our stay in Rome couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough place to stay- Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sabre255
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Amalfi for 4 nights the first week in April. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Upon our arrival we received a mini orientation of Rome from the front desk attendant. I believe his name was Francisco but I can't remember. Everyone else that worked there was helpful as well. Our room was clean and it had the best windows I've seen in a hotel. This is important because the hotel is on a very busy street but the window kept all the noise out. It also literally had 6 different curtains and shades to keep the sun out. The hotel is located about 5 blocks from the Termini train station which is the main transportation hub of Rome. It's also about a 15 min walk from the Coliseum. It's further away from the other sites (Vatican, Trevi Fountain, and Spanish Steps). The immediate area around Termini (within a block or two) is a little sketchy but we never felt uncomfortable. Two things that threw us off a little about Amalfi: 1. The bed: it wasn't a true king size bed but 2 double beds pushed together. You can feel the divide down the middle. We were so tired everyday that it didn't matter but it was a little uncomfortable. 2. You have to leave your key with the Front Desk before you leave everyday. I've never experienced that at a hotel before. There's someone on duty 24hrs a day so we never had a problem getting into the hotel but it took a day to get used to. It actually turned out to be pretty good as we never had to worry about losing our key. Also be aware that the elevator is TINY, so be prepared to make a lot of trips if you have a bunch of luggage. Overall I would recommend Amalfi to others. It's a nice hotel with a dedicated staff. If you prefer walking to everything in Rome I would probably stay somewhere a little closer to the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Warm Friendly Hospitality - Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BrownMouseTraveller
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome and we fell in love with everything!! The Amalfi accomodation was great, the room service was great, the reception staff were more than helpful & patient with our limited Italian, they booked all our tours, had kitchen staff come in early to prepare breakfast at 6.30am as we had a 7am tour, recommended everything we needed, the hotel is close to the termini, shops & everything we walked everywhere and we will definately return and stay here again!! The hotel staff helped make our trip easy and were warm and welcoming eager to assist in any way they could. Make sure you stay here!! Good value too.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base”
Reviews.Author: susierem
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to Rome for a babymoon and booked this hotel based on the reviews on this website and its location. We were not disappointed. The hotel is within walking distance of the termini (bus goes here from the airports for a few euros), and just round the corner from the Santa Maria Maggiore - making it easy to find. It was also within walking distance of the Colloseum, but we found that we ended up walking to almost all of the main sites in the city! The room was small, but think this is usual of Rome - but this was fine as how much time do you spend in your room anyway? I would have liked some tea and coffee facilities in the room but I am a typical Britain and need to have tea available at all times! The room was immaculate which was great as I seem to have developed an OCD lately. Hubby was a little disappointed with the breakfast, as he was expecting a fry-up, but the service we recieved from the staff was brilliant. All in all, we were so pleased with this hotel and would recommed to others. Oh, and Cosimo - thanks for the croissant - we did make it on our flight with time to spare. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “real italian welcome”
Reviews.Author: tahiti23
Reviews.Content: clean-well situated-pleasant welcome and breakfast-only some single rooms quite small

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RickEWaterloo_B
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money and the location makes it an easy walk to several main sights. Train station is just 10 minutes away, as is the subway. Important bus lines are even less than that. Room was small but clean; staff was extremely helpful. Breakfast was above-average, by Italian standards. Bathroom was almost a joke it was so small; if you're a "large person," I'd beware.

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying with Family”
Reviews.Author: grand dutchess
Reviews.Content: We were a group of ten friends who traveled to Rome in February and had the benefit of staying at the wonderful Hotel Amalfi. Cosimo and his staff were always there to answer our questions and we had many. Nothing was ever too much trouble. The hotel is located right near the Basicala Santa Maria Maggiore with many shops and great restaurants nearby. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable.
