We had rooms on both the third and fourth floors. I was lucky to have Room 316 which had a balcony. The bathroom layout is a little wierd but it worked. The beds were comfortable. However, the pillows were very flat. After the first night we asked for more comfortable pillows and they were there by the end of the day. The breakfast was very nice with a choice of cheeses, meats, yogurts, croissants, rolls, breads, cereals, juice, coffee, tea, and delicious cappachino. There were not hot breakfast items provided. It was just right for us though. We looked forward to seeing Natasha in the dining room every morning at breakfast. Rome is a wonderful city. Get out there and walk it. The metro and bus system was very easy to use. We also did a day trip to Orvieto which was very easy to reach by train. I would highly recommend it. Remember to throw your coin in the Trevi Fountain so you can come back to Roma again. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable & friendly”
Reviews.Author: gemzhols
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Amalfi several years ago and enjoyed this stay just as much. The staff are friendly and helpful, rooms comfortable and spotless and we got a bargain room price booking directly on the hotel's website. The hotel is very conveniently located with all main attractions within walking distance. Only gripe was no fresh fruit on the otherwise fab breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Rome-antics”
Reviews.Author: damienstjohn
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi Hotel is a lovely little hotel, 5-minute walk from the main train station and a safe distance away from the grimy, sleazy area around the Termini. Our room was a "double standard" located on the top floor, a decent size and comfortable even for two singles pushed together (which we weren't expecting). The bathroom had a shower, toilet, sink and bidet (for those that use such things). We had a charming view of the Santa Maria Maggiore (see picture), one of the largest churches in Italy, which served a more than adequate alarm clock. As with most places in Rome, roads are noisy but the sound-proofing in the room is very good. The TV didn't carry any English channels like Sky News, CNN or BBC News 24. We found the staff to be very helpful, during check-in the information was clear and detailed. They recommended a nearby Pizzeria and offered us a 10% discount if we ate there. Should you find yourself without dinner plans and want to grab something quick to eat, there are plenty of places to grab a bite although you might have to travel to the Barberini, Spagna or Piazza Navona areas for something more hearty. Included in the price was a free continental breakfast with croissants, bread, rolls, cheese, pate, cakes, biscuits, fruit and cereal served daily 7:30-9:30am. You will also find a steady stream of free tea and coffee served with a smile. The Amalfi hotel only had six tables for Breakfast and seemed a little busy on Sunday morning but the lady serving Breakfast had a cheery attitude and buzzed around keeping everyone topped up with tea and coffee. To service four floors there is a flight of stairs and one small lift, with a capacity for two people each with a suitcase, although if you've stayed in a boutique hotel before you would know what to expect. From the hotel, you'll find both the Colosseum and the Roman Forum a firm 15-minute walk. The nearest subway/tube stop is back at the Termini, we only used it once and that was to visit the Vatican which is completely the other side of Rome. The Metro costs 1 Euro per person and because it doesn't run through Rome we walked to most places, although Taxi's (official ones are White with a yellow light on top) are always available. Overall, it suited our requirements perfectly, a clean and comfortable hotel a decent distance from most of the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Manager and his staff were top notch”
Reviews.Author: KandCD
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find our tour operator Directline Holidays had not paid our bill or apparently other bills we were told by the manager "for some time". The manager was very apologetic and extremely helpful and had still kept our room. A phone call from us to the company resulted in our particular bill being settled, but not the best start. However the hotel and room (ok our shower fan didn't work) were excellent value. The staff were just so friendly.The breakfast was cold continental but fresh and more than enough for us. It is situated 10 minutes walk from the Termini which hasn't got a great name for security but we had no problems at all.It's also about 10 minutes walk to the next nearest Metro. If you're ok with walking then the hotel is fine, it's about 15minutes from the Colosseum. Enough good restaurants in the area, so if like us you were worn out at the end of the day, you didn't have to go far for a good meal and drink. The Basilica just across the square is magnificient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: Tutto33
Reviews.Content: I felt at home. I was treated very well by all staff. Great location and great breakfast. The price is good and the hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Cordiality, friendship, great location, good cost x benefit, very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SileneP
Reviews.Content: It was a great surprise to find a great service and cordiality in this small hotel near Santa Maria Magiore in Rome. All staff very courteous, worried about the satisfaction of the clients, always ready to help. Clean room, excellent location, few minutes from the metro station and the Termini Train Station. Very near the Coliseum and Roman Foro. Very good breakfast with espresso coffee, breads, cheeses, and so many other things!

Reviews.Title: “es la mejor hotel hemos estado!”
Reviews.Author: xyxy2010
Reviews.Content: For a long time, we thought that the most important things for a hotel lie in: it is clean, warm (in the winter) , quiet, and has a good location. However, after the trip to ROME we have to say that the staff of the hotel are more important! We spent three wonderful days in the hotel Amalfi in ROME. besides what i mentioned above, the most impresive thing for us is that the staff there are so nice, just like your old friends, which made me suddenly have a very good impresion of italian and forget all of the unluncky things. they are gentle, polite and humorous... I remember clearly that the day we left, they gave us a small gift to remember ROME, and the lady in the cafetaría gave us a piece of cake for our trip to spain... I don´t know if there are better hotels in Rome, maybe it is not very luxurious, but this is the best one we have stayed, not because the hotel itself is good, but bucause the staff there are really difficult to forget! since we have thrown the coin in Fontana di Trevi, the day when we come back, we will stay in this hotel again, just like to visit our old friends:) Tao

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: sue187791
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a real joy to find and a wonderful place to base yourself within this vibrant city. it benefits from being in a central location close to Termini and within walking distance to much of the central sights of Rome. We stayed for 4 nights and had an excellent stay. The room was warm, very clean and had all we needed. The bed was comfortable and the laundered cotton sheets were appreciated. The double glazing tot he windows minimised the noise and we slept very soundly on the 3rd floor which from our balcony (room 316) has an amazing view onto Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica. Breakfast was served in the small friendly dining room and was perfectly adequate and beautifully presented in a buffet style by a friendly and attentive waitress. All of the staff were exceptionally welcoming and happy to help with any requirement. We have already made plans to use this hotel again very soon when our son visits Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: smiffy27
Reviews.Content: Registration was Quick and easy. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was small but adequate, but the bathroom was cramped and would be to small for a larger person. Rates for the mini bar are very reasonable however,Tea and Coffee facilities in the rooms would make an acceptable addition.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amazing staff make this a gem!”
Reviews.Author: The_Merry_Traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband, his mother, brother and I visited Rome for Christmas. I researched hotels and chose Amalfi Hotel because of it's close proximity to the Termini Station (barely 5 minutes and a straight walk down; also under 10 minutes walking to the Coloseum) and reasonable rates. I was worried that the actual hotel wouldn't be as nice as the photos, but I was wrong. Amalfi Hotel exceeded my expectations. The hotel is small, but charming. All of us LOVED the free breakfast every morning. The staff catered to our every need and even humored our attempts to speak broken Italian phrases with big smiles. Every morning we ate breakfast as a family, which was a great way to start the sight-seeing day. The staff was amazing!!! The hotel is family-run and their care for their business and customers is evident. The rooms were bigger than I thought and perhaps just a tad smaller than standard-sized ones in the US. Overall, we were very happy with our rooms. We had plenty of hanging closet space (though no dresser). The bathrooms were extremely clean and chic. Everyday my husband and I marveled at my find; all of us were happy with our stay at Hotel Amalfi. There didn't seem to be too many (good) restaurants nearby (but a lot of quick food), although many places were closed for Christmas and Sunday (half of our stay), so we didn't get to know the neighborhood that way. However, ask Francesco for a recommendation to a great pizza place down the street (maybe a 3 minute walk) and you can watch as the pizza is baked in the pizza oven. My husband and I have no doubt that we will stay at Amalfi Hotel the next time we go to Rome!! Thank you to all of the staff for your kindness and hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “a place close to the Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: cmfaux
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. We were in town for a few days on a quick visit and loved every minute. This part of town is a bit gritty compared to other areas but I never once felt unsafe. The breakfast the hotel was tasty, the coffee was great!! The staff was super friendly and allowed us to store our luggage before we checked it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: andrewsfrancis
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay - friendly staff, nice room and 420 is great for solo-travellers as this has a balcony! All the recommendations made by the staff were spot on & I didn't feel like they were out to make a 'quick buck' and that they were running a proffessional establishment! Relief in a city filled with tourist-traps...

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Place, For A Really Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: GoshDarnGreg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 2nd wedding anniversary in Rome. We had never been there before, and we've heard pretty bad stories about staying in the less expensive hotels (room's are a lot smaller than in the pictures, dirty, crappy beds/baths, etc.).... but we gambled on one anyway, since it was all we could afford. : ) Well, it worked out, because now we know exactly where to tell our friends to stay whenever we hear they're planning on going to Rome. I'll just go over some of the important points that made me and my wife feel good about it. - It's a short 5 minute walking distance (with luggage) from the main train station. - We both felt very comfortable about what area it was in. We were thinking that it possibly could've been in a dodgy sort of area... but it was nice! - The hotel is owned and run by a father and son. They both speak very good english. They were both very accommodating (like an owner or staff member should be). STORY: In passing, we had told the person behind the front desk (the father/the owner, which we didn't know at the time) that it was our anniversary. That night, when we came back from sight-seeing all day, there was someone different behind the front desk (the son). We said hello, and he greeted us kindly and said, "Oh, please wait here for one second.. I must speak with you about something." My wife and I were both nervous that something was wrong. He then handed us a bottle of champagne, and said that his father told him that it was our anniversary! It was very, very nice, and unexpected! - The hotel room was perfectly clean, and nicely sized. Nothing to complain about. NOTE: We lucked out and got a street-view room. I have posted pictures of our view, and the room. Try to ask for one of these rooms. - The bathrooms were pretty standard to the other places we stayed while in Europe. Efficient : ) - The staff (father and son, and at late night, some other person) is/was very good at explaining things to us. What to do, where to go, etc. - If you're a newbie to Rome, I'll just let you know that you can walk everywhere you want to go from this hotel, except for the Vatican... the Vatican is just a bit further away. - There is a small market where you can get almost anything you would need to eat or drink for very good prices about 2 minutes from the hotel. My wife bought her bottle of water there for super cheap, and I got various food items and drinks for cheap. It's to the left when you exit the hotel. You could probably ask the owners and they will be able to tell you where it is. Seacrest, out.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for excellent service and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Torunn789
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to the Maria Maggiore basilica (which is beautiful), and is only a short walk from the Termini station, where you can travel onwards with bus or metro. The hotel staff were all very nice and helpful. A nice atmosphere amongst the staff and the guest. The breakfast was something to look forward to, as well. The room was small, but had all the amenities we needed, and it suited us very well. The hotel has an elevator in addition to the stairs, but this elevator is extremely small. All in all we are very happy with our choice of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice receptionist in the day shift, okay in the night shift.”
Reviews.Author: chouhappy
Reviews.Content: guess it is not so bad for a budget travel in Rome for short time. Room is okay, not too fancy but acceptable. the lady who serve you for the breakfast is quite nice, so as receptionist in the morning or afternoon. but, the old man in the night time aren't very helpful, i guess he was tired or something. watch how they said about internet. first, they will say to you first hour is free of charge, then next morning they still put on your bill. Although, it is only 3 EUR per hour for internet, but i just feel uncomfortable when they trick me to use the internet at the first time. i wasn't sure i suppose to give a tip or not. but the carpool to airport in the morning, please bring exact 14 EUR otherwise the driver will keep the change automatically then said ciao if you give him 15 EUR.. in short... Hotel is not so bad itself.. but ppl are...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: BritsAbroad777
Reviews.Content: Lovely comfortable hotel in a great location. We had a beautiful view of S. Maria Maggiore from our room, and most of the tourist spots are within easy walking distance. We walked to the Vatican & back and didn't find it particularly strenous as there was so much to see on the way! Spotlessly clean and comfortably furnished, although rooms are compact. Staff were courteous, friendly and always helpful. Nothing was too much trouble for them, and they kindly marked all the attractions on a map for us which was a great help! Breakfast was delicious and generous, with plenty on offer, such as crusty rolls, croissants, jams, cheeses, hams, etc. together with copious amounts of tasty Italian coffee. The lady serving in the breakfast room is lovely, and is pleased to help you, as are all the staff at the hotel. A trip to the Lateran Basilica at the other end of Via Merulana is highly recommended (the souvenirs here are half the price of elsewhere), and there are some good shops to browse in on the walk there and back, which are far more reasonably priced than in the overpriced touristy Centro Storico. We will definitely be staying at this hotel again, and would recommend it to anyone visiting Rome as a great base for sightseeing :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: pecas928
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. We stayed there the first days in December and really enjoyed it. The location very super convenient, the staff was really nice (Paolo and his father) and the breakfast was very generous. We stayed in other places in Italy and this was the best breakfast we had of all the hotels. We hope to come back soon! Alberto & Luz

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and genuinely plesant stay.”
Reviews.Author: jrg24676
Reviews.Content: Got in late due to problems at the airport, explained this at the desk when asked for my paperwork and the nihgt porter quickly and I thought gratefully, said to sort it out in the morning after breakfast. We found the Amalfi a very clean and plesant place to stay. And every request was met with politnes and reassurance tha they would try to achieve, We liked this hotel enough to use it again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Amalfi Hotel - Grazié”
Reviews.Author: becci101
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Amalfi hotel 1st December - 4th. Lovely little hotel in a nice location. Staff were very friendly, & when asked about local attractions gave us directions & recommendations. Le 2 Cologne is a nice restaurant not far from the hotel (they have business cards at reception) which is reasonably priced. This was the part of the trip I was worried about as I had heard it was expensive. We found though that this "old quarter" area was less touristy so the prices weren't so high. Another bar/ café to recommend is La Pasticcacio on Via Merculana. Nice barman, & brilliant measures! Termini station is about a 5-10min walk from the hotel past Santa Maria Maggiore Church. It's the easiest way to get around Rome. 4 euros for a day pass. All in all loved Rome, would return to this hotel definately. Great Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally good value for money”
Reviews.Author: KariS21
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in this lovely family hotel centrally located near many sights. The whole staff was really friendly and service really good. Our room was rather small but cozy and well cleaned every day. We received many good tips from the personell about how to arrange our day and they helped with reservations etc. Hope to stay again in this lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Only Amalfi !!!”
Reviews.Author: nimakarenko
Reviews.Content: + very friendly personnel; not big, but cozy and comfortable room; a remarkable kind on cathedral Santa Maria Magorre (truth if to get out in a window and to look on the left); very convenient site; an ideal parity the price-quality; Only Amalfi !!! - Not the breakfast not so was pleasant to coffee; in the first night have a little frozen (there were no blankets), but next day the question was solved: only Amalfi !!!

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a small high quality hotel? This is it !”
Reviews.Author: 187791Robert
Reviews.Content: Great location,close,but not too close, to the Station,and buses and Metro.Very friendly and helpful staff.Nice continental breakfast.We really enjoyed our five days in Rome.Robert and Cate Boulton 24.11.10

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, helpful and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: DanielBass89
Reviews.Content: Every member of staff I came across was exceptionally friendly and welcoming, and all were as helpful as they possibly could be. The room was of a good standard, not particularly big, but easily big enough. The bathroom was also a bit on the small side, but was pleasant and clean and had everything we needed. The only addition I would make would be comfier pillows. The location was pretty much perfect, a 5 or 10 minute walk from the train station, and a 5 or 10 minute walk in the opposite direction to the Colosseum and Roman forum. There were plenty of shops and restaurants around so food wasn't a problem. All in all a very good hotel, and I would certainly recommend it if you are going on a sightseeing trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay when visting Rome”
Reviews.Author: billcoley
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is small and friendly, in an excellent location to explore the sites of Rome. The rooms are small but very comfortable and clean. Breakfast is very good and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel that made us feel more like one of the family”
Reviews.Author: Jac1965
Reviews.Content: We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay in the hotel Amalfi and nothing was too much trouble for the staff, who make you feel like one of an extended family. If I had to find a fault (a very minor one) it was that the room was lacking in any drawer space - perhaps a small chest of drawers under the desk?

Reviews.Title: “small but beautifully formed”
Reviews.Author: Victoria499608
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and found the hotel staff very welcoming and helpful the room was lovely and well equipped. the hotel was very clean. The breakfast was lovely, simple but enoough choice and the waitress was lovely and very friendly. Would definately stay here again if going back to Rome. nice and close to Termini station so great for transport round the city - The Metro is easy to use

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: marga056
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the Amalfi Hotel for four nights and could not have been made more welcome by the lovely people who run it. The hotel is small but beautifully clean. The continental breakfast is satisfying with options for all tastes. One of the best things about this hotel, apart from the owners and staff, is its position only five minutes from the main Termini station and Piazza Cinquecento where all the buses stop. A ten minute walk takes you to the Colosseum, Palatine Hill and Imperial Fora. The metro from Termini has two lines and tickets start at only one euro so it's easy to get to all the important tourist places. Although the Amalfi only does bed and breakfast there are lots of restaurants and sandwich bars nearby and also a couple of supermarkets on the same Via Merulana. Opposite the side of the church of Santa Maria Maggiore, a 30 second walk from the hote, is pizza restaurant called Le 2 Colonne where they use a wood-fired oven and the pizzas are excellent and not expensive. The hotel gives excellent value for money and the people are so helpful, the rooms have a small safe which is free to use (unlike most hotels), they let me check in online for my flight but did not charge and they reserved a ticket for me to an opera and did not charge. I have never known a hotel ike this before!! If I ever get to Rome again I would definitely stay at the Amalfi and would advise anyone else to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly family run hotel with style”
Reviews.Author: Thoresby82
Reviews.Content: Friendly family run hotel where nothing was too much trouble. Room a bit on the small side but comfortable and clean Location excellent for exploring Rome's main tourist sites and close to bus and train stations. Old fashion style of hotel made a pleasant change from modern clinical style of some hotels. On the downside the lift is a tight squeeze and the bathroom was on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT... GREAT... GREAT...”
Reviews.Author: menchie07
Reviews.Content: The owners of this hotel are the best people you will ever meet in Rome..very pleasant, courteous, helpful and really really nice family. You can't beat the location of this hotel as it is very convenient to bus/metro. Hotel although small is very clean and cozy. Natasha our cleaning / breakfast lady is extremely wonderful and gracious. Victoria, Maria and Carina Oct 8-12, 2010 Rooms 104 & 107

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, courteous service, and convenient proximity to everything!”
Reviews.Author: rmancuso
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great for a traveller who plans on doing alot of walking in Rome to see the sites. The service is extremely courteous and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was much better than the "continental breakfast" that is stated - they had a really good array of fresh pastries, beverages, different cereals. The only thing is, it's popular with the guests, so it's a good idea to get down for breakfast for early (around 8am).

Reviews.Title: “best place in Rome. All the reviews are true. PLACE IS GREAT.”
Reviews.Author: craigstemmermann
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome. The owners were what made this hotel so great. Francesco is one of the friendliest people you will ever meet. I left paintings in the room and a friend left his cellphone and wallet. The owners went out of their way to mail them to the USA. When we left early for Tuscany the owners had breakfast to go for us, without asking. I have been to Rome 7 times and I will never stay anywhere else again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: Laur3n26
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and thought that the staff were friendly, they gave us a map and explained the main sites when we arrived and also recomended a restaurant on request which we ended up going to twice! Good breakfast, plenty available. Spacious room - we got one with a double and a single bed. Although pillows weren't that comfortable. Bathroom fine but small, not much room between toilet and shower for your legs! Good location for train station and Ancient Rome, but a bit further to walk for some of the other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff & excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: rydellgunness
Reviews.Content: Just finished our eurotrip where we stayed in Paris, Rome, Amsterdam, London & Edinburgh and I can say hotel Amalfi was the best place we stayed. Ideal location to see Rome's major attractions. Easy walk to the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. We walked back to the hotel from Trevi Fountain & the Spanish Steps..... a bit longer walk but pleasant. Easy to get to and from the airport as the hotel is about 5 mins walk from Rome's central station (Stazione Termini). The room was spotless and bigger than the other hotels we stayed at. We found out on this trip that the majority of the hotel rooms in europe are pretty small. There's an in room safe to lock up your valuables. The room airconditioning was great and definitely an essential if you are visiting Rome in the summer. The breakfast was good enough for us to have a good start to our day and allowed us to have a late lunch: lots of bread, pastries, butter, jams, ham, coffee, tea.... The staff was super friendly. The best of them was Francesco. We were fortunate that he was there to check us in becuz he drew out all the major attractions and shopping areas on a map and even checked the internet to get attraction details and opening / closing times. He even located a store so I could purchase Juventus (Del Piero of course!)soccer jerseys. Really great guy, made our stay so much better with his assistance. All in all, I would definitely reccommend this hotel to anyone as it is an excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in everyway.”
Reviews.Author: amyrenestone
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal. Centrally located, clean, very nice accomodations, super friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - no frills - nice staff”
Reviews.Author: LoveholsHampshireUK
Reviews.Content: First hotel of our 3 week holiday - 3 Star hotel wasn't expecting great things but this did disappoint. Staff very pleasant - rooms dire. We had two rooms - our daughters room was okay, but in ours not only was there no room to put our luggage we only had one big case, but in order to use the toilet one had to sit sideways. The room should have been a single and not a double. Clean & very basic - no English speaking channels at all. Breakfast was very limited, no fresh juice, no eggs no cooking facilities and one had to wait for a table as there weren't enough and breakfast was early. So, if the room doesn't matter to you & no facilities are important, but you want to be a 10 min walk from the station and a 15 min walk to Coleseum/Palentine Hill - amazing, then this is the hotel for you – Ancient Rome on your doorstep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: beachlover325
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Amalfi from July 16-21, 2010 in room 424. We stayed in a double room which was small but larger than I expected and really just enough because we were hardly ever in the room. It was very hot when we were there (close to 100 degrees) and the air conditioning was not that cold but we found this to be the case throughout Rome. When we had a problem with the a/c (it was blowing warm air) the hotel responded quickly and fixed it before we came back from dinner. The bed was not very comfortable unless you prefer a firm mattress but we were so tired every night from our busy days that it didn't really matter. The room was cleaned daily and the housekeeper did a good job. The bathroom had a tub with a hand held shower, which was annoying because it didn't attach to the wall. We weren't sure if this was how all the rooms were or just ours. Again, not a big deal but it would have been nice if it had a wall attachment. There was no dresser but the closet had two shelves (the safe was in there) for clothes. The TV was on a decent sized desk. There were no English channels - again no big deal because we had so much to see! Our room was right next to the tiny elevator - we only used it once to bring our suitcases up (only one person could fit with two suitcases). Not many people used it since the hotel only has four floors but a few did which would occasionally wake us up if it was very early. The continental breakfast was served daily. There were two types of cereals and an assortment of breads (my husband loved the croissants) along with yogurt. Coffee and juice was also available. You can purchase the Internet at the hotel (1 EURO for one hour, 3 EUROS for 3 hours and 10 EUROS for the whole day). It was pretty slow but worked well enough to check email or look up directions. The hotel staff was very kind and helpful. When we scheduled a trip to Pompeii (you can book directly through the hotel and a shuttle picks you up in the morning to take you to the tour bus) they opened breakfast early for us to eat before we left. The hotel is in a great location. It is very close to the Colosseum (about a 10 minute walk) and Roman Forum and about a 5 minute walk to Termini train station. We walked a lot everywhere and took the metro; the station being so close was very convenient. You can get to all the sites very easily from here. We were very happy with our choice of where to stay in Rome and would recommend this as a great budget hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: rocketracer
Reviews.Content: I travelled to the Amalfi with my parents for a long weekend. Having read some of the reviews on Trip Advisor I was looking forward to our stay but a few of the reviews were not favourable. We found the hotel great. After booking the hotel I received a confirmation email which advised that if we arrived early we could leave our bags to get on with our sightseeing until our rooms were ready. Luckily our rooms were ready when we arrived but we did leave our bags on our departure date which were fine. Both our rooms were fine, very clean and perfectly adequate in size as you are hardly in the room. Breakfast was a traditional continental breakfast, perfectly adequate and the fresh rolls were lovely. The hotel staff were all welcoming and helpful. They provided us with a map of the city, advised on transport and when asked, suggested a great local restaurant for us to visit which we returned to on both nights. I think it was called Novostella but they would be able to advise you. There was a mix of tourists and locals eating there, always a good sign and reasonably priced. The location was very good. Although a little close to the station which can be a little seedy at night, it gives great transport links to the airport, bus routes and metro. I would definitely recommend the hotel to friends and stay there again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to train station”
Reviews.Author: JeannieColaSC
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean and comfortable hotel. The staff was friendly but didn't really go out of their way to help you. Location was convenient to the main train station...about a 5 minute walk. There's a subway stuff at the Spanish Steps and fairly close to the Vatican. We were close enough to walk to the Spanish Steps too if interested in a little exercise. They didn't have a business center/computer which most of the hotels did have on our trip. It's also the only hotel on our trip to charge for wireless. They didn't charge very much but inconvenient to have to go back to pay when we would run out. We thought the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: ben97
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Termini station and the Metro. A very good base to visit the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcoming - beware Reception ordering you a taxi”
Reviews.Author: JanKellie
Reviews.Content: When we arrived Reception staff very unwelcoming, took an age to find our reservation - at least 15 minutes. Just gave us a key, no indication of where lift was, what floor we were on etc. When we went out the following day and returned to our room at 3.30 p.m. the hotel was locked and we had to bang on the front door to get in!! Room clean but very small, bathroom very very small, door banged on basin. We asked Reception to order us a tax for our journey to the airport. Taxi driver seemed to be a "mate" of the Reception staff and not the usual white Rome taxi. After a few minutes we noticed no meter in the taxi and the driver ripped us off charging us 45 euros for a 20 minute journey to the airport then said he had no change when I gave him 50 euros. What a scam. Good points - room was very clean, bed very comfortable indeed. Shower hot (but tiny), breakfast fairly good, croissants and rolls very fresh and plenty of food available although nothing hot. Breakfast room staff very pleasat and welcoming. Hotel located near to stop for the open bus tour which was very handy, this is to be recommended if you only have a short stay in Rome - 18 euros for two days and a lot easier on your feet!! If you are in this area go down Via Merulana about 5 minutes and down a little side street on the right and you will see the sign to Morgana Trattoria. Fabulous, mostly locals eating there. Very very reasonable prices and food cooked to order, don't be in a rush. Please avoid the Patisserie at the top of Via Merulana - one espresso, one (small) capuccino, two very small cakes - 15 euros!! - the price of two main courses at Morgana Trattoria.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with good value”
Reviews.Author: jbeeTexas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to the main Termini station as well as two other Metro stations. We used the Metro extensively during our stay and I would definitely recommend doing that. Once we did walk to the Colosseum, but it wasn't really that close. The staff was friendly and the front desk personnel spoke English. The room was very small, but had a good private bath with shower. We didn't really spend much time in the hotel anyway. The breakfast was great and the breakfast waitress was very attentive and fast. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!! Please, READ”
Reviews.Author: V0land
Reviews.Content: In the beginning, my grilfriend and I were a little sceptical about 3-star hotel having such great reviews on this website but sinse we trust it completely, we decided to give it a try. When we arrived to Rome, this hotel was one of the best things that happened to us on our trip. It was only 7 minutes from Termini walking distance (DO NOT make a mistake and take a cab from the train station - they WILL rip you off). When we came there, we were greated so friendly by the son of the owners that we felt like we belong here. He was extremely helpful showing things around on the map and even suggested itenarary for the whole stay. The hotel is 2 minutes away from Santa Maria Maggiore, which you can even see out of the window. The hop on, hop off bus stop is right next to this church. These busses run a tleast untill 7 pm and are a great source of cheap transportation (out ticket was 20 euros and was good for 48 hours) The room was great. Yes, it was small by American standards but extremely cozy; on the other hand, you didn't come to Italy to sit in the you room. There was NO weird smell in the room, it was clean (I'm a clean freak), and tidy. Air Conditioner was working perfectly, you even have a thermostat in the room. The only thing is, the shower was 3*3 feet and I would not suggest guys with over 40"-weist to stay in this hotel. They recently made improvement to the whole hotel since they bought an adjacent building, so the bathrooms are newly painted and have brand new tiles and plumbing.DO NOT open windows if AC is working fine - it can be really noisy outside The breakfast was good. Not a breakfast in IHOP for sure, but It was a buffet which had any kind of coffee you like, jams, cheese spreads, meat spreads, salami, mortadella, fruit salad, juices, croissants and many more. This breakfast really charged us at least until 1-2 pm. Beware, the breakfast is served from 7.30 to 9.30 am, unlike other hotels which serve until 10.30. The breakfast room staff, Natalia especially, made cappucino taste like heaven!!! We stayed in room 211 and paid $150 per night. The hotel was perfect for the price!!!!!!! When I come to Rome again this will be the top choice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: rabmania
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, cosy (if tiny) single room with everything you'd need (except a kettle) including aircon, safe, and tv (you can't see the tv screen however- lcd situated high on a wardrobe!). 3 mins from S Maria Maggiore and 5 minutes from termini station. You can walk to the Colosseum in twenty five minutes too. Don't bother with the inedible breakfast and the mud-like coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location and would maybe probably stay again”
Reviews.Author: abdleic
Reviews.Content: 5 mins walk from the train station. Easily accesible to all the sights Rome has to offer. The restaurants around should be avoided as they can be a bit pricey. Walk an extra 10mins and you will save yourself a lot of cash

Reviews.Title: “a good base close to termini station”
Reviews.Author: bluealien89
Reviews.Content: A 5 minute walk from termini station but not too close to the shabby area near the station. Bars/restaurants around the hotel were a little expensive but walk for about 2 mins to find somewhere cheaper. Staff were lovely. Breakfast was pastry/fruit cocktail with juice or coffee-nice but not enough to fill up on. Very clean rooms-cleaned every day. Reviews on here said rooms were very tiny-they aren't huge but they're livable if you'll be out sightseeing all day. Small but clean bathroom with a power shower. Very pleased with hotel would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing holiday, lovely hotel, gorgeous weather - what more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: easyliver
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Amalfi tired, hot and in need of sanctuary - we were greeted by exceptionally friendly staff, a charming reception area, lift, baggage room, and a map!Who were immediately sent us off to our room.. Awaiting us there - air conditioning, minibar, shuttered windows, comfy beds -the room was a twin bed, and was small I suppose by some standards, but was all we needed and more.We were extremely close to many city tours - including openair bus trips, Appian and other tours, town buses. We walked to the many attractions - colloseum, Santa Maria Magherita (at the end of Via Merulana), forum. A short bus trip away is St Peter's Basilica and Vatican - it can be walked from the Amalfi, but need good walking feet, ours weren't! The main termini station is a few minutes walk away - we even travelled to Pompei for the day (returining to our lovely Amalfi for ice cold drinks and relax!) There were some lovely restaurants, take aways, gelateria, clothes and shoe shops on the Via Merulana near to the Amalfi. After a long, hot and busy day, the Amalfi really was a sanctuary for us! We were even told that although we were checking out at 11 on our last day, we could leave our cases in the baggage room until we were due to leave - 7 in the evening, and we could use th comfortable lounge.I had read all the reviews on Expedia and wondered how realistic they were - they were! Thank you Amalfi - we will certainly return to you one day.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware - we were charged in American dollars and gentleman behind desk would not change to euros.”
Reviews.Author: viva3
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel near the train station - not far to the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, The Forum and the Coliseum - about a forty five minute walk to the heart of Rome, Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and the Vatican beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Rubyann40
Reviews.Content: Not bad location but the area was a bit seedy at night. Rooms were clean but traditonally small but avoid room 212 as I have a broom cupboard that is bigger and it overlooks the back alley! We changed to a slightly bigger room within five minutes., but were disappointed as this was our Ruby anniversary and had requested a better room. Staff generally very helpful and had a sense of humour. Lift was tiny so use the stairs if claustrophobic. Air conditioning was excellent but at prime times, the water pressure was a bit low in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and atmosphere!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenlala
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are just back from a 5 day trip to Rome where we stayed in the Hotel Amalfi. I have to say I wasn't sure what to expect from the reviews I had read....I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is located centrally but in a way that allows the visitor to see a more "real", less "tourist" side of Rome although all major sites and tourist attractions are easily obtainable via hop on hop off tour bus that is a 1 min stroll from the hotel (which is also an excellent service €18 for a two day ticket to all attractions). Hotel Amalfi is rustic and gives you a romantic feel not the bland samey atmosphere at some of the pricier hotels in the more popular areas. Breakfast is a basic continental affair - nice coffee/breads/meats/cheeses etc... very nice and just right to start your day. Staff are very friendly and helpful arranging airport transfer and recommending some fantastic places to eat. Lots of really nice places to eat/drink a couple of mins stroll from the hotel. Rooms are small but add to the feel that you are somewhere cosy and romantic. I can't wait to return to the Hotel Amalfi.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean hotel in great location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: artisanpr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Amalfi on a weekend break with my elderly mother. The hotel is just 5 mins from the Termini station and within walking distance of most sights. It has a lift so is good for older visitors. The rooms are spotless but a little small. Also depending on where your room is it can be a little noisy ( this is the only negative). The hotel staff are v.friendly and the breakfast is pretty good ( hams, cheeses, fresh rolls, pastries, juices, etc). I'd definitely reccommend this hotel for a short break in Rome .

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshirePigwig
Reviews.Content: the amalfi hotel is value for money well positioned for sightseeing, the only thing that was lacking was there was no tea or coffee making facility in the rooms after a days walking around rome a cup of coffee was needed.the rooms are very clean and the maid came everyday. breakfast was ok if you like jam and bread ! but for the price what can you expect.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Linda77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4nights on our honeymoon. It was in a good location by the church of Santa Maria Maggiore, which was about 10minutes walk from Termini, but far enough away to avoid the seedier feel of the Termini area. It was also close to a metro station, 3 minutes walk away, and there were restaurants and shops on the street. The room was double glazed so there was only the occasional bit of traffic noise and had shutters to keep the light and heat out so you could sleep late. The room was pretty tiny though - although everyone tells me all hotels in Rome are like this if you want a central location and don't want to pay hundreds of pounds. There was just enough room for the bed, a wardrobe, and two bedside tables. The bathroom had just a shower and it was really tiny - I'm 5' 11'' and found it hard to wash my hair without hitting my head on the wall, but the water pressure was good. The hotel had four floors and the lift only fitted 2 people, so it wouldn't be good for people who have a fear of tiny lifts, or can't manage stairs. You had to wait for breakfast at peak time too because the breakfast room didn't have many tables. But the staff were friendly and the location and price made up for the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Natalie88
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried about staying at the Amalfi as it had mixed reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel is well situated for the main attractions of Rome, and we walked to the Colisseum, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona and the Pantheon (although we definitely didn't feel like walking back!) It is also near Termini Station (although not too near) and the bus station. The rooms are on the small side, but nicely decorated and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was adequate with a good selection and the waitress in the mornings is very welcoming and helpful. The only problems we had were with the check-in and the telephone. As we arrived at eleven, we couldn't access our room until 1pm and this seems to be a very strict rule at the hotel. We had been travelling since 1am and were very tired, so just wanted to have anap, a shower and change our clothes. It would be nice if they had a shower/changing room for guests who are either early for check in, or have to check out in the morning but are not leaving until late in the afternoon. I have stayed at a hotel in Rome that had this facility and it was very welcome after walking around in the heat all day. The only other problem was the phone in the room, it never seemed to work. I either had no dialling tone, or once it rang the other end I got cut off. I complained twice but nobody came and checked it. All in all I would recommend this hotel if you want clean basic accommodation near all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: missmacca
Reviews.Content: I loved my 4 nights in this hotel and would stay again anytime. The location was fabulous, just 5 mins from termini and a short walk to all the attractions of Rome through nice streets. The hotel is very safe for a single person to go back to, being on a main street and always manned. The rooms were clean and basic, in fact for the price I was pleasantly surprised by them. Breakfast is a good way to fill up before you go out for the day, and nice enough. I would definately recommend it, and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off Rome”
Reviews.Author: TigersFan2008
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi hotel is small in a reasonable position .Our room was small ,the bathroom was small which meant it was difficult to relax & spread out. The breakfast was Ok with yogurt,tin fruit,rolls & sweet croisants.The breakfast room was small seating 14 guests. The bedrom had a minibar very reasonable prices compared to Rome generally. The restaurants near the hotel were expensive & quality was poor. The reception at the Amalfi was limited. Our room was on the back overlooking a courtyard & at least it was quiet. There is a modern flat screen Tv but only showed CNN news & no other English channels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but watch out!!”
Reviews.Author: Heather1959
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice although the room was very small. The problem was, there were ants in our room that bit our daughter every night, even after spraying. Just a word of CAUTION, no matter how nice you think the hotel and the staff are, - DON"T leave anything of value in your room, even while going downstairs for 30 minutes for breakfast. Someone may be watching for you to go and go into your room and steal your credit card, id card and ATM card. It happened to us.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, cheap hotel.”
Reviews.Author: traveller1111England
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to stay in rome for 3 to 4 days but we didn't want to pay hundreds of pounds on a 4 or 5 star hotel so we decided to go for a 2 to 3 star and use it just as a base and somewhere to sleep. The room was small but we didn't need a big room and it was clean. The only problems encountered were some mosquitos and the air-con didn't work. The staff were v friendly and helpful. The location was ideal (inbetween the termini and the Coloseum) for the price we paid. We got the train from the airport and then walked from the termini to the hotel as it wasn't that far away and saved a lot of money. We walked to all the tourist sites from our hotel apart from the Vatican which we rode a bus to. If you want cheap digs in a great location for sightseeing then this is definately the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “A ghost Place”
Reviews.Author: Singtao
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel online and did read the reviews before I decided on this one. I have requested for a quiet room and two days before I left to Rome, I called them just to make sure they were able to give me a quiet room. The person who answered the phone told me they have reserved us a room on the 4th floor. But when we arrived they put us on the first floor and told us all the room were full. However, the person who greeted us was cold and rude, he looked at us like take it or not. It was almost 9 in the evening and we had to take it even though with his bad attitude. The next day it was another man working in the front, this time i politely asked him to refer us a restaurant. Right away he took out a card and wrote his name at the back and told us to go there and make sure to show this card to them. So we thought, either we will get a discount from that or he got some kind of incentive by referring people to eat there. Anyway, we did went there, but did not even bother to step in. For there were only one table there and we saw two waiters were sitting in one of the table seems like they were chatting. It's just not feel right to go in. The third night we were there, i need to make a phone call. The phone in my room was not working, so I went down to ask them for assistance, again the one in the lobby was not working as well. When I report this to the man in the reception, he didn't believe me and then try dialed it himself, but also could not make any outside call. He didn't say anything but then tell me I should go look for another phone. I was so disappointed with them that I couldn't wait to get out of this place. The only person that gave us a big smile every moring was the lady who works in the restaurant, but she could not say a single word of English. My advice is, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Familyman001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amalfi for 3 nights, the room was small but comfortable and had everything we needed. The shower in the en-suite was powerful and always hot. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was very clean. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: KLM1980
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely little hotel that was very clean and with friendly staff. Room was a little small but this was reflected in the price. Ideal location - walking distance to train station, colosseum and Forum, and if you don't mind a little further walk, the rest of central Rome. Tour bus stop was 20 steps from the hotel door which came in handy for moving around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: bzavitz
Reviews.Content: Very clean and friendly, with an excellent breakfast. Rooms were small (nothing unusual for the price) but very nicely decorated. For us, it was an ideal location-- a few blocks from the train station and Metro, with several Internet and phone centres along the way, and fairly central to other points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - basic but clean - so handy”
Reviews.Author: GAWA_on_tour
Reviews.Content: As already mentioned on previous reviews, this hotel doesnt look much from outside but once in through the door, it is basic, but homely and very clean...pleasantly surprised. There were just the two of us, booked it through otel.com and got nice room with basic continential breakfast included. Staff all friendly. Rooms are small (as in most of Rome) but you have all you need for a sightseeing break. Hotel is handy (4/5 min walk) for the termini so carry luggage isn't a problem, plus there are 2 metro stations within 5 mins walk too. Not a lot of night life or resturants about the area, but we did find some nice places to eat. Basically not a lot else to do around that area at night so be prepared once you come back to the area of the hotel, that's probably you for the night. Would def recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: romevisitorCambs
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the outside it looked awful, but once you step inside its a very pleasent little hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. When our safe battery failed we had to leave the valuable hidden in the room but nothing was touched, our room was serviced everyday with clean towels and the bed made. Breakfast got a bit busy if you came down after 8am, but as we were early birds avoiding the crowds and ready at 7.30 it was not a problem. Breakfast was okay friendly staff, but didn't speak a lot of english. our room was basic but very clean, the bathroom not hugh be fine for one person to clean teeth and have a bath. We got the terravision bus (paid for at the airport after arriving on a saturday, the taxi's want to charge more), and we got a taxi back for ease, but in hindsight we wished we had saved our money and got the terravision bus. We were scared that as we could not find anywhere selling the tickets at the terminal we would get stuck but when we met some other couples who came back on the same flight they said you could pay on the bus. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mar1981
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. The hotel was clean, the rooms were very small, but we were prepared, since we have read the internet reviews. The hotel staff was very friendly, and English was not a problem. The Termini Station is very near, and there are many restaurants and Italian "fast food places" (pizza-to-go, pizza which you pay per kilo : very good, very simple, very fast) nearby. The breakfast was not very special (we are from Holland, so we are used to eat more than they eat in southern European countries in the morning), but that is normal in Italy, so no problem (I loved the small packages with Emmenthaler cheese). Nevertheless, be prepared: the room we had was very very small, do not expect too much! The price is good, as well as the friendly staff, the clean rooms, and of course the location near the Termini Station and other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: opi
Reviews.Content: Well situated within easy reach of train station and metro. Clean and comfortable with friendly and very helpful staff. We would definately return to this hotel and have no hesitation in recommending it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Way too small!!”
Reviews.Author: canucme
Reviews.Content: First, I would just like to say that my stay was pleasant at the Amalfi Hotel in Rome, due to the fact that the personnel at the front desk was nothing short of friendly and accomendating. Having said that, I will warn you that if you're traveling alone like I was, to definitley not stay here because the rooms are entirely too small for even one person. You can't even turn around in the bathroom without hitting your shoulder or elbow up against something, and that's not worth it considering you will be paying at least 30 euros more for a single room!! Get a double insted which is still way too cramped. Even though the room was basically clean, I still wouldn't recommend this Hotel. Also they are very stingy on towels too. No bathtub, just a shower which is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break to Rome and would like to say how happy we were with this hotel as we were a little apprehensive about the area. The location turned out to be great for exploring the city either by foot or the short walk to and from Termini Station (access to the airport).Also plenty of shops, cafes etc on the doorstep.Room was more than adequate and comfortable and the staff were v.helpful and eager to please. All in all, we would not hesitate to go back to this quiet, reasonable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite OK, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: eurofrog
Reviews.Content: The Amalfi Hotel is first of all a clean, little hotel conveniently located very close to Santa Maria Maggiore and near the Termini railway station and via Nazionale. Rome's historic attractions are within walking distance if you're up for a bit of exercise (the Colosseum is about 15 minutes away). Facilities in the Amalfi are quite basic, though. Nonetheless, by Roman standards, the hotel offers value for money (we paid 78 euros for a double room per night via the minotel.com website). Unlike some other hotels - especially in the historic centre - the Amalfi is not a rip-off and does not pretend to be more than it is. Staff were friendly enough but not always brilliant. The night porter was a grumpy old man who was clearly unhappy about the prospect of us returning after 1am, in which case we would have had to ring the door bell and (presumably) get him out of bed. When checking in, I was reassured that there would be no problem if I came back after 1am... Breakfast was nothing to write home about, but then it rarely is in Roman hotels and I am usually more than happy to forego hotel breakfasts and have a coffee and some fresh bakery things at a local cafe bar. There is a bakery near the Amalfi that does the most amazing coffee. Its croissants, pastries, Italian cookies, etc. are close to perfection. (Leave the hotel, turn right and walk down via Merulana, away from Santa Maria Maggiore, crossing one or two streets until you come to a pedestrianised little street with a bakery at the corner on your left. I think the street is called Largo Leopardini.) To cut a long story short, this hotel is recommendable if you want affordable, down-to-earth accommodation that is neither shabby nor lacks comforts such as your own private bathroom (which was small, but functional) and a TV in your room. Most importantly, the bed was very comfortable. This is a place for a decent night's sleep, but if you want luxury accommodation and want to do more in your hotel than to sleep, you're probably better off finding somewhere else - although it will be more pricy.

HotelInfo.Name: Amalfi Hotel
